meanings.definition: Showing a lack of sensitivity or tact
meanings.sent1: She made a brashier comment without thinking about others' feelings.
meanings.sent2: His brashier behavior often led to misunderstandings with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The brashier joke he made at the party left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her brashier attitude towards criticism made her a tough competitor.
meanings.sent5: The brashier tone of his voice made it clear he was not happy.

meanings.definition: More brash or bold than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: The new student was brashier than the others in expressing his opinions.
meanings.sent2: Her brashier approach to negotiations often yielded positive results.
meanings.sent3: The brashier outfit she wore to the event turned heads everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His brashier decision to quit his job shocked everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The brashier colors of the painting made it stand out among the rest.
